newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Sale of Tabaqueira possible this year - official.
newsitem.headline: Sale of Tabaqueira possible this year - official.

text.p: The privatisation of Portuguese tobacco company Tabaqueira could take place in 1996, but the exact timing will depend on the country's competition watchdog and the Economy Ministry, a senior official said.
"I think the privatisation will still be possible this year, but the timing does not depend on us," Under-Secretary for Finance, Fernando Teixeira dos Santos, told Reuters.
"It depends on the people involved in the Competition Council and the Economy Ministry," he said.

The Economy Ministry has referred the selloff of Tabaqueira, scheduled for this year in the government's privatisation calendar, to the Competition Council for an opinion on the impact on the local market, a ministry spokesman said.
The spokesman said the newly-formed Council, which formally takes office next Monday, would have 30 days to study the case.

The candidates to buy Tabaqueira are the U.S. group Philip Morris, in partnership with Portugal's Jorge de Mello group; state-owned Spanish tobacco company Tabacalera, allied to Madeira company Empresa Madeirense de Tabacos; and French group Seita.

Although the only official target date for the sale of a 65 percent stake in Tabaqueira is the end of the year, government officials had said previously that they hoped the sale would be wrapped up in early November.

The Economy Ministry, which is responsible for the state's industrial holdings, had decided to seek the opinion of the Competition Council because whoever won the bidding would clearly dominate the local tobacco market, the spokesman said.
Tabaqueira accounts for 70 percent of Portuguese cigarette sales.
